publish.title: Title
publish.name: Name
publish.submitConfirmation: Are you sure you want to submit this information?
publish.surnameChanged: Observed change in Surname from grid.
publish.surnameNotChanged: No recent changes in grid Surname detected.
publish.dynamicListUsingArrayProxyKM: A Dynamic List Of Products using an ArrayProxy holding Komodo Models (not required for read only situations)
publish.dynamicListUsingArrayProxyEO: A Dynamic List Of Products using an ArrayProxy holding standard Ember Objects
publish.loopIterationWithReference: Iteration over a loop showing one technique to get a reference to the collection items.
publish.buttonEachLoopMessage:
The buttons shown in the list above are produced in a #each loop. The binding context
in each iteration of the loop is the item associated with row in the list above. As
such, we can use the binding context to get a handle to this object and can use it as a
parameter to a controller method call. See the sendProductDetails() method in PublishState.js
and the sendProductDetails() method in PublishController.js for a code sample. The selected
product as retrieved from this binding context is used to display the message below.
publish.dependentCachedPropertiesSampleMessage:
Sample showing cascaded drop downs using caching. Countries uses a cached property since its static.
Provinces is dyanmic and uses a computed property.
publish.actionViewsMessage:
Action Views are Clickable Areas that can be used to fire and action when the user clicks in a given area.
In the example, below, the details for the products are clickable.

publish.removeItemFromGridPagingMessage: Remove one item above to show that the paging control is removed when there are too few items in the list.
publish.collapsibleViewMessage:
The CollapsibleView control makes it possible to collapse and expand content areas.
Click the CollapsibleView title area to expand or hide the the content below.
CollapsibleViews contain inline templates, just like all other standard Ember views do.
publish.collapsibleViewSubMessage: Like standard Ember views, CollapsibleViews support nested views such as the buttons below
